All we like sheep have gone astray/own way. Every one of us has gone astray from the strait and narrow path; every soul who has ever lived—except for Jesus—has sinned (Rom. 3:23; 1 Pet. 2:25; 1 Jn. 1:8, 10). Rather than walking the Lord's path, we walk our own way.

laid on him the iniquities. This passage harks back to the meaning of the ritual of the Day of Atonement (Lev. 16), when the high priest laid his hand on the head of the victim and, in essence, transferred to him the sins of the people. Jesus suffered "for our offences" (Rom. 4:25), not his own.
